name: saliency
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being important to or connected with what is happening or being discussed: saliency of I would like to discuss the saliency of local issues in this election. Religion is not necessarily losing its saliency, but its role in society is changing.
More examplesFewer examplesUrban popular culture gained a new saliency among young people.The saliency of this problem is greater in the United States than in Europe.Different types of information may increase the saliency of a particular opinion.
